data.title: Node 6.10.x incorrectly triggers legacy debug mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Node 6.10.x (I installed current LTS 6.10.2)
2. Debug any Node JS application
3. Debug Console reports `Debugging with legacy protocol because Node v6.10.2 was detected.`

My assumption is that the version parsing thinks 6.10.2 is earlier than 6.3 due to lexical comparison?

data.title: Markdown links with spaces do not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.49|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|;


When using markdown links, links with a space in the link are not shown as links in the preview window.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a markdown file (file with extension .md)
2. Enter text below:

   ` [This example does not work](C:\Program Files\Common Files\System\DirectDB.dll) `
   ` [This example works](C:\Windows\explorer.exe) `
3. Switch to preview mode. Above examples are show as:

   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4982940/25040911/9aea7ab2-210c-11e7-9a6c-02e26079ca24.png)

data.title: The 'protocol' parameter is ignored if node debugging starts from an extension
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Win10
- Node Version: 7.7.4

Steps to Reproduce:

My extension starts debugging via this code:
```js
vscode.commands.executeCommand("vscode.startDebug", {
            "type": "node",
            "protocol": "auto", // this line I've added to prevent showing the 'deprecation' message
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch current test(s) with TestCafe",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/testcafe/lib/cli/index.js",
            "args": args,
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        });
```

But I still see the warning: `(node:34248) DeprecationWarning: node --debug is deprecated. Please use node --inspect instead.`. 

It looks like the 'protocol' parameter is ignored. If I change its value to 'inspector' the deprecation message is not changed.

This is the full output:
`node --debug-brk=40687 --nolazy node_modules\testcafe\lib\cli\index.js chrome c:\Sources\2017.1\testcafe-tests\bootstrap\demos-gridview\Templates.js --test 'XXX' 
(node:34248) DeprecationWarning: node --debug is deprecated. Please use node --inspect instead.
Debugger listening on 127.0.0.1:40687`

data.title: Feature Request: Goto tab by number
data.body:
In chrome and most other browsers/editors, we can go to a particular tab by pressing the Command key and the number. For example: If we press Command+1 we will go to the first tab, Command+2 takes to the second tab, etc.

It will be good if visual studio provides a way (either by default or after configuring) to move to a particular tab by number, using along with a keyboard shortcut.

Stackoverflow link where I asked this initially: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41951206/visual-studio-code-go-to-a-tab-by-number

data.title: Shift+Home does not work as expected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 (10.0.15063.138)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write any text, i.e `    Test    Test2`.
1. Place cursor right after the word 'Test', press <kbd>Enter</kbd>.
1. Then press <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Home</kbd>.

You will notice that it marks the empty spaces towards the word Test2 (backwards), but it should mark the empty spaces to the beginning of the line. 

![shifthomebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7189721/25037117/911e077a-20f7-11e7-80ff-8432952a03d7.gif)

data.title: Cannot Set "Enable script execution in markdown preview for this workspace" For Directly Opened Markdown File
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new markdown file, and insert a reference as : <script type="text/javascript" src="http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=default"></script>
2. Open the preview of current md document.
3. A notice appeared on the right-top of the preview window : Script has been disabled in this document.
4. Click the notice and then select pop out option : Enable script execution in markdown preview for this workspace.
5. The notice "Script has been disabled in this document" is till there and I tried using a new line with "$$x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}$$" and turn out the script is still disabled in this document.

data.title: Intellisense not recognizing ES6 JavaScript prototype method on import
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:01:14.464Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-72-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|prettier-eslint-vscode|RobinMalfait|0.5.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Create class ("Foo") with prototype method ("Foo.prototype.add") in file "class.js" and export

```
export default Foo
```

2.Import Foo (using ES6 import - not require) into file "import.js"
```
import Foo from "./class.js"
```
3. In "import.js"  - create instance of class

```
var newFoo = new Foo()
```
4. Start typing the instance.method
```
newFoo.a
```
Expected: is the method will be autocompleted to show newFoo.add
Result: method is not autocompleted (though method works when run)

data.title: Strange(Incorrect) translate in 1.11.2
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows (Not OS related issue)

Steps to Reproduce:
- Source Control: Translated to "源控件", Translate it back to English, it was "Origin Control", and "Control" mean "manage something", but translate "控件" only mean "A control, like button on the form'
- Commit Staged(Signed off): Translated to "递交已暂存的更改(已注销)", translate "已注销" mean "already logged out"
- Should not translate Git command, it's a command. See #6388

data.title: Allow multiple peek/references widget or store history
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

It would be very helpful to allow more than one set of references / location list / peek widget to be shown at the same time.

For example, in this image I'm looking at all `IpcMessage` derived types. If I want to look at the references of `IpcQuit`, the derived type reference view is closed and cannot be easily retrieved (especially if I've navigated to a separate part of the code base).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356714/25035103/6147f1f2-20a0-11e7-81ee-806728818338.png)

data.title: Emacs-Style "Electric Indent"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: - OS Version: Windows 10 Creators Update Steps to Reproduce: 1. Have a block of text 2. Press "Tab" Expected behaviour: The content jumps to the auto-level of indentation. In Emacs, this occurs wherever you press "tab", so, ```html

Foo

``` a tab on the line with the `

` will properly indent the line, no matter where the mark is. Since "tab" has other behaviour in VSCode, I propose that it would do this only when no other behaviour would be executed.

data.title: VSCode doesn't autodetect settings changes if settings file is symlinked
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Arch Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Move the `settings.json` from `~/.config/Code/User/settings.json`.
2. Create a symlink at `~/.config/Code/User/settings.json` pointing to the file.
3. Open VSCode. Change a setting related to UI (`fontSize`).

Expected: The change in setting is reflected in the editor.

Observed: The change is not picked up. However, closing VSCode and reopening it seems to fix the issue.

## Extended Information:

There are no issues with hardlinks though.

Here's a script to automate it.

```bash
mv -b ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json ~/settings.json
ln -s ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json ~/settings.json
code settings.json
```

data.title: Application is crashed when press toggleDevTools shortcut ['ctrl + f12']
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-css-formatter|aeschli|0.0.2|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.3.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.0.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.
Defined a shortcut for toggleDevTools, for example 'ctrl + f12'

    {
        "key": "ctrl+f12",
        "command": "workbench.action.toggleDevTools"
    }

2.
Press the shortcut serveral times, the application is crashed.

**Addtional**
I haved defined other shortcuts('s', 'ctrl + b'), and the issue appears again.

**Expected Result** 
The application can toggle dev tools correctly.

**Actual Result**
The application is crashed.

data.title: Add workbench color theme keys for terminal background and foreground colors
